items.title: Trump authorises deployment of 300 National Guard troops to Chicago
items.standfirst: The controversial move follows protests over ramped-up immigration enforcement and the shooting of a woman during unrest on Saturday.
items.content: The controversial move follows protests over ramped-up immigration enforcement and the shooting of a woman during unrest on Saturday.

items.title: Trump authorizes national guard deployment to Chicago, White House says, as border patrol there shoots woman
items.standfirst: Illinois governor JB Pritzker says administration is escalating ‘aggression against Illinois citizens and residents’Donald Trump has moved to deploy the national guard in another city by authorizing 300 troops to protect federal officers and assets in Chicago, where the government said border patrol agents shot and injured a woman while firing at someone who tried to run them over.White House spokesperson Abigail Jackson confirmed that the president had authorized using Illinois national guard members, citing what she called “ongoing violent riots and lawlessness” that local leaders have not quelled. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Judge blocks Trump administration from deploying national guard to Portland
items.standfirst: US district judge agrees with Oregon assertion that deployment would likely inflame rather than calm protests in cityA federal judge has blocked the Trump administration from deploying the national guard to Portland, Oregon, according to court documents.Donald Trump had announced on 27 September that he would deploy troops to Portland, “authorizing Full Force, if necessary”, ignoring pleas from local officials and the state’s congressional delegation, who suggested that the president was misinformed or lying about the nature and scale of a single, small protest outside one federal immigration enforcement office. Continue reading...
items.content: US district judge agrees with Oregon assertion that deployment would likely inflame rather than calm protests in cityA federal judge has blocked the Trump administration from deploying the national guard to Portland, Oregon, according to court documents.Donald Trump had announced on 27 September that he would deploy troops to Portland, “authorizing Full Force, if necessary”, ignoring pleas from local officials and the state’s congressional delegation, who suggested that the president was misinformed or lying about the nature and scale of a single, small protest outside one federal immigration enforcement office. Continue reading...

items.title: Japan set for first female prime minister
items.standfirst: Japan could be about to have its first female prime minister, as a woman is elected leader of the governing party.
items.content: Japan could be about to have its first female prime minister, as a woman is elected leader of the governing party.

items.title: Japan poised to get first female PM after Sanae Takaichi wins ruling party leadership
items.standfirst: Margaret Thatcher admirer beat her more moderate rival to become leader of Liberal Democratic partyJapan is poised to get its first female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP) – a victory that should lead to her being installed as the country’s new leader in the middle of the month.Takaichi, a rightwing politician who has voiced admiration for Margaret Thatcher in her quest to build a “strong and prosperous” Japan on the international stage, beat her moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a runoff election at the LDP headquarters in Tokyo on Saturday. Continue reading...
items.content: Margaret Thatcher admirer beat her more moderate rival to become leader of Liberal Democratic partyJapan is poised to get its first female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi was elected as leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP) – a victory that should lead to her being installed as the country’s new leader in the middle of the month.Takaichi, a rightwing politician who has voiced admiration for Margaret Thatcher in her quest to build a “strong and prosperous” Japan on the international stage, beat her moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a runoff election at the LDP headquarters in Tokyo on Saturday. Continue reading...

items.title: Sanae Takaichi set to become Japan's first female prime minister

items.content: Takaichi is a long-time admirer of Margaret Thatcher, but many female voters do not see her as an advocate for progress.

ai_summary: Sanae Takaichi, a conservative, was elected leader of Japan's ruling party.
This victory positions her to become the country's next prime minister.
Takaichi is known for her admiration of Margaret Thatcher.
She beat her more moderate rival, Shinjiro Koizumi, in a runoff vote.
The election could lead to her being installed as leader mid-month.

clusters.title: Billionaire populist Andrej Babis' party wins Czech parliamentary election
clusters.neutral_headline: Populist Billionaire Wins Czech Election

items.title: Billionaire populist Andrej Babis' party wins Czech parliamentary election
items.standfirst: However, his ANO party falls short of an overall majority in preliminary results.
items.content: However, his ANO party falls short of an overall majority in preliminary results.

items.title: Andrej Babis leads vote count in Czech parliamentary election
items.standfirst: Billionaire Andrej Babis's ANO party cruised to victory in the Czech Republic's parliamentary election on Saturday, raising the prospect of a government that would boost Europe's populist, anti-immigration camp and reduce support for Ukraine. "It is one of the greatest results ever for any party in the history of the modern Czech Republic", said Ian Willoughby, FRANCE 24 correspondent in Prague.
items.content: Billionaire Andrej Babis's ANO party cruised to victory in the Czech Republic's parliamentary election on Saturday, raising the prospect of a government that would boost Europe's populist, anti-immigration camp and reduce support for Ukraine. "It is one of the greatest results ever for any party in the history of the modern Czech Republic", said Ian Willoughby, FRANCE 24 correspondent in Prague.

items.title: Populist billionaire Andrej Babiš wins Czech parliamentary election
items.standfirst: With Babiš’s victory the Czech Republic looks set to join Hungary and Slovakia in refusing support for UkraineThe populist billionaire Andrej Babiš has won the Czech Republic parliamentary elections, preliminary results show, but fallen short of the overall majority.This win marks a political comeback for Babiš, who was prime minister from 2017 to 2021. He is expected to put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and towards Hungary and Slovakia, who have taken a pro-Russian path. Continue reading...
items.content: With Babiš’s victory the Czech Republic looks set to join Hungary and Slovakia in refusing support for UkraineThe populist billionaire Andrej Babiš has won the Czech Republic parliamentary elections, preliminary results show, but fallen short of the overall majority.This win marks a political comeback for Babiš, who was prime minister from 2017 to 2021. He is expected to put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and towards Hungary and Slovakia, who have taken a pro-Russian path. Continue reading...

items.title: Populist billionaire Andrej Babis’s party set to win Czech election

items.content: With most votes tallied, Babis’s ANO party is ahead, but it appears set to fall short of a majority in parliament.

items.title: 'Trumpist' billionaire Andrej Babis wins Czech parliamentary election
items.standfirst: Populist, billionaire and self-proclaimed "Trumpist" Andrej Babis won the Czech parliamentary election Saturday in a political comeback that put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and toward Hungary and Slovakia, which have taken a pro-Russian path.
items.content: Populist, billionaire and self-proclaimed "Trumpist" Andrej Babis won the Czech parliamentary election Saturday in a political comeback that put the country on a course away from supporting Ukraine and toward Hungary and Slovakia, which have taken a pro-Russian path.

items.title: Billionaire Babis's party on track to win Czech election
items.standfirst: Billionaire Andrej Babis's ANO party was on track to win the Czech Republic's parliamentary election on Saturday (October 4). FRANCE 24's Ian Willoughby tells us more.
items.content: Billionaire Andrej Babis's ANO party was on track to win the Czech Republic's parliamentary election on Saturday (October 4). FRANCE 24's Ian Willoughby tells us more.

ai_summary: Andrej Babis's ANO party won the Czech parliamentary election.
Babis's party fell short of an overall majority in the results.
The win marks a political comeback for Babis.
He is expected to shift the country away from supporting Ukraine.
The country may align with Hungary and Slovakia's pro-Russian path.

clusters.title: Russian strike hits train station in Ukraine, killing at least one
clusters.neutral_headline: Russian Strike Hits Ukraine Railway Station

items.title: Russian strike hits train station in Ukraine, killing at least one
items.standfirst: Russian drones struck trains at a station in Ukraine's northern Sumy region, killing one person and injuring at least 30 others, officials said on Saturday (October 4), with Ukraine's foreign minister accusing Moscow of deliberately hitting passenger trains.
items.content: Russian drones struck trains at a station in Ukraine's northern Sumy region, killing one person and injuring at least 30 others, officials said on Saturday (October 4), with Ukraine's foreign minister accusing Moscow of deliberately hitting passenger trains.

items.title: Person killed in drone attack as Ukraine accuses Russia of targeting passenger trains
items.standfirst: Two trains were hit in Ukraine’s northern Sumy region, killing one and injuring about 30 others, officials sayTwo Russian drones struck trains at a station in Ukraine’s northern Sumy region, killing one person and injuring about 30 others, officials said on Saturday, with Ukraine’s foreign minister accusing Moscow of deliberately hitting passenger trains.“A brutal Russian drone strike on the railway station in Shostka, Sumy region,” wrote the Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, on Telegram, posting a video of a wrecked, burning passenger carriage and others with their windows blown out. Continue reading...
items.content: Two trains were hit in Ukraine’s northern Sumy region, killing one and injuring about 30 others, officials sayTwo Russian drones struck trains at a station in Ukraine’s northern Sumy region, killing one person and injuring about 30 others, officials said on Saturday, with Ukraine’s foreign minister accusing Moscow of deliberately hitting passenger trains.“A brutal Russian drone strike on the railway station in Shostka, Sumy region,” wrote the Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, on Telegram, posting a video of a wrecked, burning passenger carriage and others with their windows blown out. Continue reading...

items.title: At least 30 injured in Russian strike on railway station, Zelensky says
items.standfirst: Preliminary reports indicate that train staff and passengers were at the site of the strike, he says.
items.content: Preliminary reports indicate that train staff and passengers were at the site of the strike, he says.

items.title: Russia strikes hit two passenger trains in northern Ukraine
items.standfirst: Dozens were injured and one killed after a Russian drone attack hit a Ukrainian railway station on Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said. Moscow is stepping up its strikes on Ukraine's railway network, which is essential for military transport, targeting it almost every day for the past two months.
items.content: Dozens were injured and one killed after a Russian drone attack hit a Ukrainian railway station on Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said. Moscow is stepping up its strikes on Ukraine's railway network, which is essential for military transport, targeting it almost every day for the past two months.

items.title: Russian attack on passenger train in Ukraine’s Sumy kills one, injures 30
items.standfirst: President Zelenskyy condemns Moscow's latest strike on Ukraine's railway infrastructure.
items.content: President Zelenskyy condemns Moscow's latest strike on Ukraine's railway infrastructure.

items.title: One dead and several injured after Russian drone strike on Ukrainian railway station
items.standfirst: At least one person has died, and several others injured, in a Russian drone strike on a Ukrainian railway station, the country's state emergency services has said.
items.content: At least one person has died, and several others injured, in a Russian drone strike on a Ukrainian railway station, the country's state emergency services has said.

ai_summary: A Russian drone strike hit a train station in Ukraine's Sumy region.
One person was killed, and about 30 others were injured in the attack.
Ukrainian President Zelenskyy condemned the attack on the railway.
The attack targeted passenger trains, according to officials.
Moscow is increasing strikes on Ukraine's railway infrastructure.

items.content: The closures are the latest after mysterious drone overflights in the airspace of European Union member countries.

items.title: Munich airport resumes operations after more drone sightings halted flights
items.standfirst: The German airport says that 46 flights had been cancelled or delayed, affecting 6,500 passengers.
items.content: The German airport says that 46 flights had been cancelled or delayed, affecting 6,500 passengers.

items.title: Flights resume 'progressively' at Munich airport after second drone scare
items.standfirst: Flights resumed "progressively" on Saturday (October 4) at Munich airport, but delays were expected after a drone scare caused a second shutdown in as many days, affecting over 6,500 passengers, the operator said.
items.content: Flights resumed "progressively" on Saturday (October 4) at Munich airport, but delays were expected after a drone scare caused a second shutdown in as many days, affecting over 6,500 passengers, the operator said.

items.title: Munich airport resumes flights after suspected drones force second closure in 24 hours
items.standfirst: Flights were suspended for several hours on Friday night, with around 6,500 passengers affected.
items.content: Flights were suspended for several hours on Friday night, with around 6,500 passengers affected.

ai_summary: Munich Airport resumed operations after a second drone scare.
Flights were suspended for several hours due to the drone sightings.
The airport experienced delays and cancellations.
The second closure affected over 6,500 passengers.
The closures are the latest in a series of drone-related incidents.

clusters.title: US envoys head to Egypt for Gaza ceasefire talks as Trump says ‘we are very close’ to deal
clusters.neutral_headline: US Envoys Head to Egypt for Gaza Ceasefire Talks

items.title: US envoys head to Egypt for Gaza ceasefire talks as Trump says ‘we are very close’ to deal
items.standfirst: US president says he will push to finalize agreement in the coming days even as scores of Palestinians killed in latest Israeli attacksDonald Trump’s son-in-law and a senior envoy are heading to Egypt to begin ceasefire negotiations, the White House has said, as the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, said he hoped to bring all remaining hostages home in the coming days.A White House official said the US president was sending his envoys, Jared Kushner and Steve Witkoff, to Egypt on Saturday to finalise the technical details of a hostage release and discuss a lasting ceasefire deal a day after Hamas said it was ready to free hostages under Trump’s plan to end the two-year-old war. In an interview, Trump said “we are very close” to reaching an agreement. Continue reading...
items.content: US president says he will push to finalize agreement in the coming days even as scores of Palestinians killed in latest Israeli attacksDonald Trump’s son-in-law and a senior envoy are heading to Egypt to begin ceasefire negotiations, the White House has said, as the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, said he hoped to bring all remaining hostages home in the coming days.A White House official said the US president was sending his envoys, Jared Kushner and Steve Witkoff, to Egypt on Saturday to finalise the technical details of a hostage release and discuss a lasting ceasefire deal a day after Hamas said it was ready to free hostages under Trump’s plan to end the two-year-old war. In an interview, Trump said “we are very close” to reaching an agreement. Continue reading...

items.title: ‘I feel like we are in a trap’: Gaza residents hopeful but wary of Trump’s plan
items.standfirst: Hamas’s agreement to release all hostages and surrender power hailed internationally as Israeli attacks continueWhen Arij al-Farra heard that Hamas had partially agreed to Donald Trump’s plan and that the US president had ordered Israel to stop bombing Gaza, the first thing she felt was a flicker of hope. The second thing she felt was an explosion. An Israeli aircraft had dropped a bomb close to her tent in Khan Younis, southern Gaza.Though it was luck that saved Farra from death, she took the attack as a bad omen for the prospects for peace in Gaza. Continue reading...
items.content: Hamas’s agreement to release all hostages and surrender power hailed internationally as Israeli attacks continueWhen Arij al-Farra heard that Hamas had partially agreed to Donald Trump’s plan and that the US president had ordered Israel to stop bombing Gaza, the first thing she felt was a flicker of hope. The second thing she felt was an explosion. An Israeli aircraft had dropped a bomb close to her tent in Khan Younis, southern Gaza.Though it was luck that saved Farra from death, she took the attack as a bad omen for the prospects for peace in Gaza. Continue reading...

items.title: US-backed peace plan for Gaza: What to expect from further negotiations?
items.standfirst: Israel's army said Saturday (October 4) that it would advance preparations for the first phase of Donald Trump's plan to end the war in Gaza. Two envoys of US President Donald Trump headed to Egypt on Saturday to discuss the release of hostages in Gaza, while Israeli forces launched deadly strikes across the territory. For more analysis on US-backed plan, FRANCE 24's Catherine Viette is joined by Hussein Ibish, senior resident scholar at the Arab Gulf States Insitute in Washington.
items.content: Israel's army said Saturday (October 4) that it would advance preparations for the first phase of Donald Trump's plan to end the war in Gaza. Two envoys of US President Donald Trump headed to Egypt on Saturday to discuss the release of hostages in Gaza, while Israeli forces launched deadly strikes across the territory. For more analysis on US-backed plan, FRANCE 24's Catherine Viette is joined by Hussein Ibish, senior resident scholar at the Arab Gulf States Insitute in Washington.

clusters.title: ICE wants to build a 24/7 social media surveillance team
clusters.neutral_headline: ICE Wants to Build Out a 24/7 Social Media Surveillance Team

items.title: ICE wants to build a 24/7 social media surveillance team
items.standfirst: ICE plans to hire contractors to scan platforms to target people for deportation.
items.content: United States immigration authorities are moving to dramatically expand their social media surveillance, with plans to hire nearly 30 contractors to sift through posts, photos, and messages—raw material to be transformed into intelligence for deportation raids and arrests. Federal contracting records reviewed by WIRED show that the agency is seeking private vendors to run a multiyear surveillance program out of two of its little-known targeting centers. The program envisions stationing nearly 30 private analysts at Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) facilities in Vermont and Southern California. Their job: Scour Facebook, TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and other platforms, converting posts and profiles into fresh leads for enforcement raids. The initiative is still at the request-for-information stage, a step agencies use to gauge interest from contractors before an official bidding process. But draft planning documents show the scheme is ambitious: ICE wants a contractor capable of staffing the centers around the clock, constantly processing cases on tight deadlines, and supplying the agency with the latest and greatest subscription-based surveillance software.Read full article Comments

items.title: Japan days away from running out of Asahi Super Dry due to cyber attack – reports
items.standfirst: The attack forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing its signature beerThe Asahi group, Japan’s biggest brewery, is reportedly just days away from running out of its most popular beer, as it struggles to recover from a cyber-attack that caused a system outage.The ransomware attack, reported on Monday, forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing it signature mass-market lager Asahi Super Dry.
